018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase;
019
020import static org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY;
021import static org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Tag.TAG_LENGTH_SIZE;
022
023import java.io.DataOutput;
024import java.io.DataOutputStream;
025import java.io.IOException;
026import java.io.OutputStream;
027import java.math.BigDecimal;
028import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.Iterator;
031import java.util.List;

034import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.TagCompressionContext;
035import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.util.Dictionary;

037import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ByteBufferUtils;

043/**
044 * Utility methods helpful slinging {@link Cell} instances. It has more powerful and rich set of
045 * APIs than those in {@link CellUtil} for internal usage.
046 */
047@InterfaceAudience.Private
048public final class PrivateCellUtil {
049
050  /**
051   * Private constructor to keep this class from being instantiated.
052   */
053  private PrivateCellUtil() {
054  }
055
056  /******************* ByteRange *******************************/
057
058  public static ByteRange fillRowRange(Cell cell, ByteRange range) {
059    return range.set(cell.getRowArray(), cell.getRowOffset(), cell.getRowLength());
060  }
061
062  public static ByteRange fillFamilyRange(Cell cell, ByteRange range) {
063    return range.set(cell.getFamilyArray(), cell.getFamilyOffset(), cell.getFamilyLength());
064  }
065
066  public static ByteRange fillQualifierRange(Cell cell, ByteRange range) {
067    return range.set(cell.getQualifierArray(), cell.getQualifierOffset(),
068      cell.getQualifierLength());
069  }
070
071  public static ByteRange fillValueRange(Cell cell, ByteRange range) {
072    return range.set(cell.getValueArray(), cell.getValueOffset(), cell.getValueLength());
073  }
074
075  public static ByteRange fillTagRange(Cell cell, ByteRange range) {
076    return range.set(cell.getTagsArray(), cell.getTagsOffset(), cell.getTagsLength());
077  }
078
079  /********************* misc *************************************/
080
081  public static byte getRowByte(Cell cell, int index) {
082    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
083      return ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowByteBuffer()
084        .get(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowPosition() + index);
085    }
086    return cell.getRowArray()[cell.getRowOffset() + index];
087  }
088
089  public static byte getQualifierByte(Cell cell, int index) {
090    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
091      return ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getQualifierByteBuffer()
092        .get(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getQualifierPosition() + index);
093    }
094    return cell.getQualifierArray()[cell.getQualifierOffset() + index];
095  }
096
097  public static ByteBuffer getValueBufferShallowCopy(Cell cell) {
098    ByteBuffer buffer =
099      ByteBuffer.wrap(cell.getValueArray(), cell.getValueOffset(), cell.getValueLength());
100    return buffer;
101  }
102
103  /** Returns A new cell which is having the extra tags also added to it. */
104  public static ExtendedCell createCell(ExtendedCell cell, List<Tag> tags) {
105    return createCell(cell, TagUtil.fromList(tags));
106  }
107
108  /** Returns A new cell which is having the extra tags also added to it. */
109  public static ExtendedCell createCell(ExtendedCell cell, byte[] tags) {
110    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
111      return new TagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell, tags);
112    }
113    return new TagRewriteCell(cell, tags);
114  }
115
116  public static ExtendedCell createCell(ExtendedCell cell, byte[] value, byte[] tags) {
117    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
118      return new ValueAndTagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell, value,
119        tags);
120    }
121    return new ValueAndTagRewriteCell(cell, value, tags);
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * This can be used when a Cell has to change with addition/removal of one or more tags. This is
126   * an efficient way to do so in which only the tags bytes part need to recreated and copied. All
127   * other parts, refer to the original Cell.
128   */
129  static class TagRewriteCell implements ExtendedCell {
130    protected ExtendedCell cell;
131    protected byte[] tags;
132    private static final int HEAP_SIZE_OVERHEAD = ClassSize.OBJECT + 2 * ClassSize.REFERENCE;
133
134    /**
135     * Construct a TagRewriteCell
136     * @param cell The original Cell which it rewrites
137     * @param tags the tags bytes. The array suppose to contain the tags bytes alone.
138     */
139    public TagRewriteCell(ExtendedCell cell, byte[] tags) {
140      assert tags != null;
141      this.cell = cell;
142      this.tags = tags;
143      // tag offset will be treated as 0 and length this.tags.length
144      if (this.cell instanceof TagRewriteCell) {
145        // Cleaning the ref so that the byte[] can be GCed
146        ((TagRewriteCell) this.cell).tags = null;
147      }
148    }
149
150    @Override
151    public byte[] getRowArray() {
152      return cell.getRowArray();
153    }
154
155    @Override
156    public int getRowOffset() {
157      return cell.getRowOffset();
158    }
159
160    @Override
161    public short getRowLength() {
162      return cell.getRowLength();
163    }
164
165    @Override
166    public byte[] getFamilyArray() {
167      return cell.getFamilyArray();
168    }
169
170    @Override
171    public int getFamilyOffset() {
172      return cell.getFamilyOffset();
173    }
174
175    @Override
176    public byte getFamilyLength() {
177      return cell.getFamilyLength();
178    }
179
180    @Override
181    public byte[] getQualifierArray() {
182      return cell.getQualifierArray();
183    }
184
185    @Override
186    public int getQualifierOffset() {
187      return cell.getQualifierOffset();
188    }
189
190    @Override
191    public int getQualifierLength() {
192      return cell.getQualifierLength();
193    }
194
195    @Override
196    public long getTimestamp() {
197      return cell.getTimestamp();
198    }
199
200    @Override
201    public byte getTypeByte() {
202      return cell.getTypeByte();
203    }
204
205    @Override
206    public long getSequenceId() {
207      return cell.getSequenceId();
208    }
209
210    @Override
211    public byte[] getValueArray() {
212      return cell.getValueArray();
213    }
214
215    @Override
216    public int getValueOffset() {
217      return cell.getValueOffset();
218    }
219
220    @Override
221    public int getValueLength() {
222      return cell.getValueLength();
223    }
224
225    @Override
226    public byte[] getTagsArray() {
227      return this.tags;
228    }
229
230    @Override
231    public int getTagsOffset() {
232      return 0;
233    }
234
235    @Override
236    public int getTagsLength() {
237      if (null == this.tags) {
238        // Nulled out tags array optimization in constructor
239        return 0;
240      }
241      return this.tags.length;
242    }
243
244    @Override
245    public long heapSize() {
246      long sum = HEAP_SIZE_OVERHEAD + cell.heapSize();
247      if (this.tags != null) {
248        sum += ClassSize.sizeOf(this.tags);
249      }
250      return sum;
251    }
252
253    @Override
254    public void setTimestamp(long ts) throws IOException {
255      // The incoming cell is supposed to be ExtendedCell type.
256      PrivateCellUtil.setTimestamp(cell, ts);
257    }
258
259    @Override
260    public void setTimestamp(byte[] ts) throws IOException {
261      // The incoming cell is supposed to be ExtendedCell type.
262      PrivateCellUtil.setTimestamp(cell, ts);
263    }
264
265    @Override
266    public void setSequenceId(long seqId) throws IOException {
267      // The incoming cell is supposed to be ExtendedCell type.
268      PrivateCellUtil.setSequenceId(cell, seqId);
269    }
270
271    @Override
272    public int write(OutputStream out, boolean withTags) throws IOException {
273      int len = ((ExtendedCell) this.cell).write(out, false);
274      if (withTags && this.tags != null) {
275        // Write the tagsLength 2 bytes
276        out.write((byte) (0xff & (this.tags.length >> 8)));
277        out.write((byte) (0xff & this.tags.length));
278        out.write(this.tags);
279        len += KeyValue.TAGS_LENGTH_SIZE + this.tags.length;
280      }
281      return len;
282    }
283
284    @Override
285    public int getSerializedSize(boolean withTags) {
286      int len = ((ExtendedCell) this.cell).getSerializedSize(false);
287      if (withTags && this.tags != null) {
288        len += KeyValue.TAGS_LENGTH_SIZE + this.tags.length;
289      }
290      return len;
291    }
292
293    @Override
294    public void write(ByteBuffer buf, int offset) {
295      offset = KeyValueUtil.appendTo(this.cell, buf, offset, false);
296      int tagsLen = this.tags == null ? 0 : this.tags.length;
297      if (tagsLen > 0) {
298        offset = ByteBufferUtils.putAsShort(buf, offset, tagsLen);
299        ByteBufferUtils.copyFromArrayToBuffer(buf, offset, this.tags, 0, tagsLen);
300      }
301    }
302
303    @Override
304    public ExtendedCell deepClone() {
305      ExtendedCell clonedBaseCell = this.cell.deepClone();
306      return new TagRewriteCell(clonedBaseCell, this.tags);
307    }
308  }
309
310  static class TagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell extends ByteBufferExtendedCell {
311
312    protected ByteBufferExtendedCell cell;
313    protected byte[] tags;
314    private static final int HEAP_SIZE_OVERHEAD = ClassSize.OBJECT + 2 * ClassSize.REFERENCE;
315
316    /**
317     * @param cell The original ByteBufferExtendedCell which it rewrites
318     * @param tags the tags bytes. The array suppose to contain the tags bytes alone.
319     */
320    public TagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell(ByteBufferExtendedCell cell, byte[] tags) {
321      assert tags != null;
322      this.cell = cell;
323      this.tags = tags;
324      // tag offset will be treated as 0 and length this.tags.length
325      if (this.cell instanceof TagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell) {
326        // Cleaning the ref so that the byte[] can be GCed
327        ((TagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell) this.cell).tags = null;
328      }
329    }
330
331    @Override
332    public byte[] getRowArray() {
333      return this.cell.getRowArray();
334    }
335
336    @Override
337    public int getRowOffset() {
338      return this.cell.getRowOffset();
339    }
340
341    @Override
342    public short getRowLength() {
343      return this.cell.getRowLength();
344    }
345
346    @Override
347    public byte[] getFamilyArray() {
348      return this.cell.getFamilyArray();
349    }
350
351    @Override
352    public int getFamilyOffset() {
353      return this.cell.getFamilyOffset();
354    }
355
356    @Override
357    public byte getFamilyLength() {
358      return this.cell.getFamilyLength();
359    }
360
361    @Override
362    public byte[] getQualifierArray() {
363      return this.cell.getQualifierArray();
364    }
365
366    @Override
367    public int getQualifierOffset() {
368      return this.cell.getQualifierOffset();
369    }
370
371    @Override
372    public int getQualifierLength() {
373      return this.cell.getQualifierLength();
374    }
375
376    @Override
377    public long getTimestamp() {
378      return this.cell.getTimestamp();
379    }
380
381    @Override
382    public byte getTypeByte() {
383      return this.cell.getTypeByte();
384    }
385
386    @Override
387    public long getSequenceId() {
388      return this.cell.getSequenceId();
389    }
390
391    @Override
392    public byte[] getValueArray() {
393      return this.cell.getValueArray();
394    }
395
396    @Override
397    public int getValueOffset() {
398      return this.cell.getValueOffset();
399    }
400
401    @Override
402    public int getValueLength() {
403      return this.cell.getValueLength();
404    }
405
406    @Override
407    public byte[] getTagsArray() {
408      return this.tags;
409    }
410
411    @Override
412    public int getTagsOffset() {
413      return 0;
414    }
415
416    @Override
417    public int getTagsLength() {
418      if (null == this.tags) {
419        // Nulled out tags array optimization in constructor
420        return 0;
421      }
422      return this.tags.length;
423    }
424
425    @Override
426    public void setSequenceId(long seqId) throws IOException {
427      PrivateCellUtil.setSequenceId(this.cell, seqId);
428    }
429
430    @Override
431    public void setTimestamp(long ts) throws IOException {
432      PrivateCellUtil.setTimestamp(this.cell, ts);
433    }
434
435    @Override
436    public void setTimestamp(byte[] ts) throws IOException {
437      PrivateCellUtil.setTimestamp(this.cell, ts);
438    }
439
440    @Override
441    public long heapSize() {
442      long sum = HEAP_SIZE_OVERHEAD + cell.heapSize();
443      // this.tags is on heap byte[]
444      if (this.tags != null) {
445        sum += ClassSize.sizeOf(this.tags);
446      }
447      return sum;
448    }
449
450    @Override
451    public int write(OutputStream out, boolean withTags) throws IOException {
452      int len = ((ExtendedCell) this.cell).write(out, false);
453      if (withTags && this.tags != null) {
454        // Write the tagsLength 2 bytes
455        out.write((byte) (0xff & (this.tags.length >> 8)));
456        out.write((byte) (0xff & this.tags.length));
457        out.write(this.tags);
458        len += KeyValue.TAGS_LENGTH_SIZE + this.tags.length;
459      }
460      return len;
461    }
462
463    @Override
464    public int getSerializedSize(boolean withTags) {
465      int len = ((ExtendedCell) this.cell).getSerializedSize(false);
466      if (withTags && this.tags != null) {
467        len += KeyValue.TAGS_LENGTH_SIZE + this.tags.length;
468      }
469      return len;
470    }
471
472    @Override
473    public void write(ByteBuffer buf, int offset) {
474      offset = KeyValueUtil.appendTo(this.cell, buf, offset, false);
475      int tagsLen = this.tags == null ? 0 : this.tags.length;
476      if (tagsLen > 0) {
477        offset = ByteBufferUtils.putAsShort(buf, offset, tagsLen);
478        ByteBufferUtils.copyFromArrayToBuffer(buf, offset, this.tags, 0, tagsLen);
479      }
480    }
481
482    @Override
483    public ExtendedCell deepClone() {
484      ExtendedCell clonedBaseCell = this.cell.deepClone();
485      if (clonedBaseCell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
486        return new TagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell((ByteBufferExtendedCell) clonedBaseCell,
487          this.tags);
488      }
489      return new TagRewriteCell(clonedBaseCell, this.tags);
490    }
491
492    @Override
493    public ByteBuffer getRowByteBuffer() {
494      return this.cell.getRowByteBuffer();
495    }
496
497    @Override
498    public int getRowPosition() {
499      return this.cell.getRowPosition();
500    }
501
502    @Override
503    public ByteBuffer getFamilyByteBuffer() {
504      return this.cell.getFamilyByteBuffer();
505    }
506
507    @Override
508    public int getFamilyPosition() {
509      return this.cell.getFamilyPosition();
510    }
511
512    @Override
513    public ByteBuffer getQualifierByteBuffer() {
514      return this.cell.getQualifierByteBuffer();
515    }
516
517    @Override
518    public int getQualifierPosition() {
519      return this.cell.getQualifierPosition();
520    }
521
522    @Override
523    public ByteBuffer getValueByteBuffer() {
524      return this.cell.getValueByteBuffer();
525    }
526
527    @Override
528    public int getValuePosition() {
529      return this.cell.getValuePosition();
530    }
531
532    @Override
533    public ByteBuffer getTagsByteBuffer() {
534      return this.tags == null ? HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_BUFFER : ByteBuffer.wrap(this.tags);
535    }
536
537    @Override
538    public int getTagsPosition() {
539      return 0;
540    }
541  }
542
543  static class ValueAndTagRewriteCell extends TagRewriteCell {
544
545    protected byte[] value;
546
547    public ValueAndTagRewriteCell(ExtendedCell cell, byte[] value, byte[] tags) {
548      super(cell, tags);
549      this.value = value;
550    }
551
552    @Override
553    public byte[] getValueArray() {
554      return this.value;
555    }
556
557    @Override
558    public int getValueOffset() {
559      return 0;
560    }
561
562    @Override
563    public int getValueLength() {
564      return this.value == null ? 0 : this.value.length;
565    }
566
567    @Override
568    public long heapSize() {
569      long sum = ClassSize.REFERENCE + super.heapSize();
570      if (this.value != null) {
571        sum += ClassSize.sizeOf(this.value);
572      }
573      return sum;
574    }
575
576    @Override
577    public int write(OutputStream out, boolean withTags) throws IOException {
578      return write(out, withTags, this.cell, this.value, this.tags);
579    }
580
581    /**
582     * Made into a static method so as to reuse the logic within
583     * ValueAndTagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell
584     */
585    static int write(OutputStream out, boolean withTags, Cell cell, byte[] value, byte[] tags)
586      throws IOException {
587      int valLen = value == null ? 0 : value.length;
588      ByteBufferUtils.putInt(out, KeyValueUtil.keyLength(cell));// Key length
589      ByteBufferUtils.putInt(out, valLen);// Value length
590      int len = 2 * Bytes.SIZEOF_INT;
591      len += writeFlatKey(cell, out);// Key
592      if (valLen > 0) {
593        out.write(value);// Value
594      }
595      len += valLen;
596      if (withTags && tags != null) {
597        // Write the tagsLength 2 bytes
598        out.write((byte) (0xff & (tags.length >> 8)));
599        out.write((byte) (0xff & tags.length));
600        out.write(tags);
601        len += KeyValue.TAGS_LENGTH_SIZE + tags.length;
602      }
603      return len;
604    }
605
606    @Override
607    public int getSerializedSize(boolean withTags) {
608      return super.getSerializedSize(withTags) - this.cell.getValueLength() + this.value.length;
609    }
610
611    @Override
612    public void write(ByteBuffer buf, int offset) {
613      write(buf, offset, this.cell, this.value, this.tags);
614    }
615
616    /**
617     * Made into a static method so as to reuse the logic within
618     * ValueAndTagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell
619     */
620    static void write(ByteBuffer buf, int offset, ExtendedCell cell, byte[] value, byte[] tags) {
621      offset = ByteBufferUtils.putInt(buf, offset, KeyValueUtil.keyLength(cell));// Key length
622      offset = ByteBufferUtils.putInt(buf, offset, value.length);// Value length
623      offset = KeyValueUtil.appendKeyTo(cell, buf, offset);
624      ByteBufferUtils.copyFromArrayToBuffer(buf, offset, value, 0, value.length);
625      offset += value.length;
626      int tagsLen = tags == null ? 0 : tags.length;
627      if (tagsLen > 0) {
628        offset = ByteBufferUtils.putAsShort(buf, offset, tagsLen);
629        ByteBufferUtils.copyFromArrayToBuffer(buf, offset, tags, 0, tagsLen);
630      }
631    }
632
633    @Override
634    public ExtendedCell deepClone() {
635      ExtendedCell clonedBaseCell = this.cell.deepClone();
636      return new ValueAndTagRewriteCell(clonedBaseCell, this.value, this.tags);
637    }
638  }
639
640  static class ValueAndTagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell extends TagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell {
641
642    protected byte[] value;
643
644    public ValueAndTagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell(ByteBufferExtendedCell cell, byte[] value,
645      byte[] tags) {
646      super(cell, tags);
647      this.value = value;
648    }
649
650    @Override
651    public byte[] getValueArray() {
652      return this.value;
653    }
654
655    @Override
656    public int getValueOffset() {
657      return 0;
658    }
659
660    @Override
661    public int getValueLength() {
662      return this.value == null ? 0 : this.value.length;
663    }
664
665    @Override
666    public ByteBuffer getValueByteBuffer() {
667      return ByteBuffer.wrap(this.value);
668    }
669
670    @Override
671    public int getValuePosition() {
672      return 0;
673    }
674
675    @Override
676    public long heapSize() {
677      long sum = ClassSize.REFERENCE + super.heapSize();
678      if (this.value != null) {
679        sum += ClassSize.sizeOf(this.value);
680      }
681      return sum;
682    }
683
684    @Override
685    public int write(OutputStream out, boolean withTags) throws IOException {
686      return ValueAndTagRewriteCell.write(out, withTags, this.cell, this.value, this.tags);
687    }
688
689    @Override
690    public int getSerializedSize(boolean withTags) {
691      return super.getSerializedSize(withTags) - this.cell.getValueLength() + this.value.length;
692    }
693
694    @Override
695    public void write(ByteBuffer buf, int offset) {
696      ValueAndTagRewriteCell.write(buf, offset, this.cell, this.value, this.tags);
697    }
698
699    @Override
700    public ExtendedCell deepClone() {
701      ExtendedCell clonedBaseCell = this.cell.deepClone();
702      if (clonedBaseCell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
703        return new ValueAndTagRewriteByteBufferExtendedCell((ByteBufferExtendedCell) clonedBaseCell,
704          this.value, this.tags);
705      }
706      return new ValueAndTagRewriteCell(clonedBaseCell, this.value, this.tags);
707    }
708  }
709
710  public static boolean matchingRows(final Cell left, final byte[] buf, final int offset,
711    final int length) {
712    if (left instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
713      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getRowByteBuffer(),
714        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getRowPosition(), left.getRowLength(), buf, offset, length);
715    }
716    return Bytes.equals(left.getRowArray(), left.getRowOffset(), left.getRowLength(), buf, offset,
717      length);
718  }
719
720  public static boolean matchingFamily(final Cell left, final byte[] buf, final int offset,
721    final int length) {
722    if (left instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
723      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getFamilyByteBuffer(),
724        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getFamilyPosition(), left.getFamilyLength(), buf, offset,
725        length);
726    }
727    return Bytes.equals(left.getFamilyArray(), left.getFamilyOffset(), left.getFamilyLength(), buf,
728      offset, length);
729  }
730
731  /**
732   * Finds if the qualifier part of the cell and the KV serialized byte[] are equal
733   * @param left   the cell with which we need to match the qualifier
734   * @param buf    the serialized keyvalue format byte[]
735   * @param offset the offset of the qualifier in the byte[]
736   * @param length the length of the qualifier in the byte[]
737   * @return true if the qualifier matches, false otherwise
738   */
739  public static boolean matchingQualifier(final Cell left, final byte[] buf, final int offset,
740    final int length) {
741    if (buf == null) {
742      return left.getQualifierLength() == 0;
743    }
744    if (left instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
745      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getQualifierByteBuffer(),
746        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getQualifierPosition(), left.getQualifierLength(), buf,
747        offset, length);
748    }
749    return Bytes.equals(left.getQualifierArray(), left.getQualifierOffset(),
750      left.getQualifierLength(), buf, offset, length);
751  }
752
753  /**
754   * Finds if the start of the qualifier part of the Cell matches <code>buf</code>
755   * @param left       the cell with which we need to match the qualifier
756   * @param startsWith the serialized keyvalue format byte[]
757   * @return true if the qualifier have same staring characters, false otherwise
758   */
759  public static boolean qualifierStartsWith(final Cell left, final byte[] startsWith) {
760    if (startsWith == null || startsWith.length == 0) {
761      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot pass an empty startsWith");
762    }
763    if (left.getQualifierLength() < startsWith.length) {
764      return false;
765    }
766    if (left instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
767      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getQualifierByteBuffer(),
768        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getQualifierPosition(), startsWith.length, startsWith, 0,
769        startsWith.length);
770    }
771    return Bytes.equals(left.getQualifierArray(), left.getQualifierOffset(), startsWith.length,
772      startsWith, 0, startsWith.length);
773  }
774
775  public static boolean matchingColumn(final Cell left, final byte[] fam, final int foffset,
776    final int flength, final byte[] qual, final int qoffset, final int qlength) {
777    if (!matchingFamily(left, fam, foffset, flength)) {
778      return false;
779    }
780    return matchingQualifier(left, qual, qoffset, qlength);
781  }
782
783  public static boolean matchingValue(final Cell left, final Cell right, int lvlength,
784    int rvlength) {
785    if (left instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell && right instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
786      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getValueByteBuffer(),
787        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getValuePosition(), lvlength,
788        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) right).getValueByteBuffer(),
789        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) right).getValuePosition(), rvlength);
790    }
791    if (left instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
792      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getValueByteBuffer(),
793        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) left).getValuePosition(), lvlength, right.getValueArray(),
794        right.getValueOffset(), rvlength);
795    }
796    if (right instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
797      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) right).getValueByteBuffer(),
798        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) right).getValuePosition(), rvlength, left.getValueArray(),
799        left.getValueOffset(), lvlength);
800    }
801    return Bytes.equals(left.getValueArray(), left.getValueOffset(), lvlength,
802      right.getValueArray(), right.getValueOffset(), rvlength);
803  }
804
805  public static boolean matchingType(Cell a, Cell b) {
806    return a.getTypeByte() == b.getTypeByte();
807  }
808
809  public static boolean matchingTags(final Cell left, final Cell right, int llength, int rlength) {
810    if (left instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell && right instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
811      ByteBufferExtendedCell leftBBCell = (ByteBufferExtendedCell) left;
812      ByteBufferExtendedCell rightBBCell = (ByteBufferExtendedCell) right;
813      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(leftBBCell.getTagsByteBuffer(), leftBBCell.getTagsPosition(),
814        llength, rightBBCell.getTagsByteBuffer(), rightBBCell.getTagsPosition(), rlength);
815    }
816    if (left instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
817      ByteBufferExtendedCell leftBBCell = (ByteBufferExtendedCell) left;
818      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(leftBBCell.getTagsByteBuffer(), leftBBCell.getTagsPosition(),
819        llength, right.getTagsArray(), right.getTagsOffset(), rlength);
820    }
821    if (right instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
822      ByteBufferExtendedCell rightBBCell = (ByteBufferExtendedCell) right;
823      return ByteBufferUtils.equals(rightBBCell.getTagsByteBuffer(), rightBBCell.getTagsPosition(),
824        rlength, left.getTagsArray(), left.getTagsOffset(), llength);
825    }
826    return Bytes.equals(left.getTagsArray(), left.getTagsOffset(), llength, right.getTagsArray(),
827      right.getTagsOffset(), rlength);
828  }
829
830  /**
831   * Return true if a delete type, a {@link KeyValue.Type#Delete} or a {KeyValue.Type#DeleteFamily}
832   * or a {@link KeyValue.Type#DeleteColumn} KeyValue type.
833   */
834  public static boolean isDelete(final byte type) {
835    return KeyValue.Type.Delete.getCode() <= type && type <= KeyValue.Type.DeleteFamily.getCode();
836  }
837
838  /** Returns True if this cell is a {@link KeyValue.Type#Delete} type. */
839  public static boolean isDeleteType(ExtendedCell cell) {
840    return cell.getTypeByte() == KeyValue.Type.Delete.getCode();
841  }
842
843  public static boolean isDeleteFamily(final Cell cell) {
844    return cell.getTypeByte() == KeyValue.Type.DeleteFamily.getCode();
845  }
846
847  public static boolean isDeleteFamilyVersion(final ExtendedCell cell) {
848    return cell.getTypeByte() == KeyValue.Type.DeleteFamilyVersion.getCode();
849  }
850
851  public static boolean isDeleteColumns(final ExtendedCell cell) {
852    return cell.getTypeByte() == KeyValue.Type.DeleteColumn.getCode();
853  }
854
855  public static boolean isDeleteColumnVersion(final ExtendedCell cell) {
856    return cell.getTypeByte() == KeyValue.Type.Delete.getCode();
857  }
858
859  /** Returns True if this cell is a delete family or column type. */
860  public static boolean isDeleteColumnOrFamily(ExtendedCell cell) {
861    int t = cell.getTypeByte();
862    return t == KeyValue.Type.DeleteColumn.getCode() || t == KeyValue.Type.DeleteFamily.getCode();
863  }
864
865  public static byte[] cloneTags(Cell cell) {
866    byte[] output = new byte[cell.getTagsLength()];
867    copyTagsTo(cell, output, 0);
868    return output;
869  }
870
871  /** Copies the tags info into the tag portion of the cell */
872  public static int copyTagsTo(Cell cell, byte[] destination, int destinationOffset) {
873    int tlen = cell.getTagsLength();
874    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
875      ByteBufferUtils.copyFromBufferToArray(destination,
876        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getTagsByteBuffer(),
877        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getTagsPosition(), destinationOffset, tlen);
878    } else {
879      System.arraycopy(cell.getTagsArray(), cell.getTagsOffset(), destination, destinationOffset,
880        tlen);
881    }
882    return destinationOffset + tlen;
883  }
884
885  /** Copies the tags info into the tag portion of the cell */
886  public static int copyTagsTo(Cell cell, ByteBuffer destination, int destinationOffset) {
887    int tlen = cell.getTagsLength();
888    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
889      ByteBufferUtils.copyFromBufferToBuffer(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getTagsByteBuffer(),
890        destination, ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getTagsPosition(), destinationOffset, tlen);
891    } else {
892      ByteBufferUtils.copyFromArrayToBuffer(destination, destinationOffset, cell.getTagsArray(),
893        cell.getTagsOffset(), tlen);
894    }
895    return destinationOffset + tlen;
896  }
897
898  /**
899   * Return tags in the given Cell as a List
900   * @param cell The Cell
901   * @return Tags in the given Cell as a List
902   */
903  public static List<Tag> getTags(Cell cell) {
904    List<Tag> tags = new ArrayList<>();
905    Iterator<Tag> tagsItr = tagsIterator(cell);
906    while (tagsItr.hasNext()) {
907      tags.add(tagsItr.next());
908    }
909    return tags;
910  }
911
912  /**
913   * Retrieve Cell's first tag, matching the passed in type
914   * @param cell The Cell
915   * @param type Type of the Tag to retrieve
916   * @return Optional, empty if there is no tag of the passed in tag type
917   */
918  public static Optional<Tag> getTag(Cell cell, byte type) {
919    boolean bufferBacked = cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell;
920    int length = cell.getTagsLength();
921    int offset =
922      bufferBacked ? ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getTagsPosition() : cell.getTagsOffset();
923    int pos = offset;
924    while (pos < offset + length) {
925      int tagLen;
926      if (bufferBacked) {
927        ByteBuffer tagsBuffer = ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getTagsByteBuffer();
928        tagLen = ByteBufferUtils.readAsInt(tagsBuffer, pos, TAG_LENGTH_SIZE);
929        if (ByteBufferUtils.toByte(tagsBuffer, pos + TAG_LENGTH_SIZE) == type) {
930          return Optional.of(new ByteBufferTag(tagsBuffer, pos, tagLen + TAG_LENGTH_SIZE));
931        }
932      } else {
933        tagLen = Bytes.readAsInt(cell.getTagsArray(), pos, TAG_LENGTH_SIZE);
934        if (cell.getTagsArray()[pos + TAG_LENGTH_SIZE] == type) {
935          return Optional
936            .of(new ArrayBackedTag(cell.getTagsArray(), pos, tagLen + TAG_LENGTH_SIZE));
937        }
938      }
939      pos += TAG_LENGTH_SIZE + tagLen;
940    }
941    return Optional.empty();
942  }
943
944  /**
945   * Utility method to iterate through the tags in the given cell.
946   * @param cell The Cell over which tags iterator is needed.
947   * @return iterator for the tags
948   */
949  public static Iterator<Tag> tagsIterator(final Cell cell) {
950    final int tagsLength = cell.getTagsLength();
951    // Save an object allocation where we can
952    if (tagsLength == 0) {
953      return TagUtil.EMPTY_TAGS_ITR;
954    }
955    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
956      return tagsIterator(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getTagsByteBuffer(),
957        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getTagsPosition(), tagsLength);
958    }
959
960    return new Iterator<Tag>() {
961      private int offset = cell.getTagsOffset();
962      private int pos = offset;
963      private int endOffset = offset + cell.getTagsLength() - 1;
964
965      @Override
966      public boolean hasNext() {
967        return this.pos < endOffset;
968      }
969
970      @Override
971      public Tag next() {
972        if (hasNext()) {
973          byte[] tags = cell.getTagsArray();
974          int curTagLen = Bytes.readAsInt(tags, this.pos, Tag.TAG_LENGTH_SIZE);
975          Tag tag = new ArrayBackedTag(tags, pos, curTagLen + TAG_LENGTH_SIZE);
976          this.pos += Bytes.SIZEOF_SHORT + curTagLen;
977          return tag;
978        }
979        return null;
980      }
981
982      @Override
983      public void remove() {
984        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
985      }
986    };
987  }
988
989  public static Iterator<Tag> tagsIterator(final ByteBuffer tags, final int offset,
990    final int length) {
991    return new Iterator<Tag>() {
992      private int pos = offset;
993      private int endOffset = offset + length - 1;
994
995      @Override
996      public boolean hasNext() {
997        return this.pos < endOffset;
998      }
999
1000      @Override
1001      public Tag next() {
1002        if (hasNext()) {
1003          int curTagLen = ByteBufferUtils.readAsInt(tags, this.pos, Tag.TAG_LENGTH_SIZE);
1004          Tag tag = new ByteBufferTag(tags, pos, curTagLen + Tag.TAG_LENGTH_SIZE);
1005          this.pos += Bytes.SIZEOF_SHORT + curTagLen;
1006          return tag;
1007        }
1008        return null;
1009      }
1010
1011      @Override
1012      public void remove() {
1013        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1014      }
1015    };
1016  }
1017
1018  /**
1019   * Returns true if the first range start1...end1 overlaps with the second range start2...end2,
1020   * assuming the byte arrays represent row keys
1021   */
1022  public static boolean overlappingKeys(final byte[] start1, final byte[] end1, final byte[] start2,
1023    final byte[] end2) {
1024    return (end2.length == 0 || start1.length == 0 || Bytes.compareTo(start1, end2) < 0)
1025      && (end1.length == 0 || start2.length == 0 || Bytes.compareTo(start2, end1) < 0);
1026  }
1027
1028  /** Write rowkey excluding the common part. */
1029  public static void writeRowKeyExcludingCommon(Cell cell, short rLen, int commonPrefix,
1030    DataOutputStream out) throws IOException {
1031    if (commonPrefix == 0) {
1032      out.writeShort(rLen);
1033    } else if (commonPrefix == 1) {
1034      out.writeByte((byte) rLen);
1035      commonPrefix--;
1036    } else {
1037      commonPrefix -= KeyValue.ROW_LENGTH_SIZE;
1038    }
1039    if (rLen > commonPrefix) {
1040      writeRowSkippingBytes(out, cell, rLen, commonPrefix);
1041    }
1042  }
1043
1044  /**
1045   * Writes the row from the given cell to the output stream excluding the common prefix
1046   * @param out     The dataoutputstream to which the data has to be written
1047   * @param cell    The cell whose contents has to be written
1048   * @param rlength the row length
1049   */
1050  public static void writeRowSkippingBytes(DataOutputStream out, Cell cell, short rlength,
1051    int commonPrefix) throws IOException {
1052    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
1053      ByteBufferUtils.copyBufferToStream((DataOutput) out,
1054        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowByteBuffer(),
1055        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowPosition() + commonPrefix, rlength - commonPrefix);
1056    } else {
1057      out.write(cell.getRowArray(), cell.getRowOffset() + commonPrefix, rlength - commonPrefix);
1058    }
1059  }
1060
1061  /**
1062   * Find length of common prefix in keys of the cells, considering key as byte[] if serialized in
1063   * {@link KeyValue}. The key format is &lt;2 bytes rk len&gt;&lt;rk&gt;&lt;1 byte cf
1064   * len&gt;&lt;cf&gt;&lt;qualifier&gt;&lt;8 bytes timestamp&gt;&lt;1 byte type&gt;
1065   * @param c1                the cell
1066   * @param c2                the cell
1067   * @param bypassFamilyCheck when true assume the family bytes same in both cells. Pass it as true
1068   *                          when dealing with Cells in same CF so as to avoid some checks
1069   * @param withTsType        when true check timestamp and type bytes also.
1070   * @return length of common prefix
1071   */
1072  public static int findCommonPrefixInFlatKey(Cell c1, Cell c2, boolean bypassFamilyCheck,
1073    boolean withTsType) {
1074    // Compare the 2 bytes in RK length part
1075    short rLen1 = c1.getRowLength();
1076    short rLen2 = c2.getRowLength();
1077    int commonPrefix = KeyValue.ROW_LENGTH_SIZE;
1078    if (rLen1 != rLen2) {
1079      // early out when the RK length itself is not matching
1080      return ByteBufferUtils.findCommonPrefix(Bytes.toBytes(rLen1), 0, KeyValue.ROW_LENGTH_SIZE,
1081        Bytes.toBytes(rLen2), 0, KeyValue.ROW_LENGTH_SIZE);
1082    }
1083    // Compare the RKs
1084    int rkCommonPrefix = 0;
1085    if (c1 instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell && c2 instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
1086      rkCommonPrefix =
1087        ByteBufferUtils.findCommonPrefix(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c1).getRowByteBuffer(),
1088          ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c1).getRowPosition(), rLen1,
1089          ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c2).getRowByteBuffer(),
1090          ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c2).getRowPosition(), rLen2);
1091    } else {
1092      // There cannot be a case where one cell is BBCell and other is KeyValue. This flow comes
1093      // either
1094      // in flush or compactions. In flushes both cells are KV and in case of compaction it will be
1095      // either
1096      // KV or BBCell
1097      rkCommonPrefix = ByteBufferUtils.findCommonPrefix(c1.getRowArray(), c1.getRowOffset(), rLen1,
1098        c2.getRowArray(), c2.getRowOffset(), rLen2);
1099    }
1100    commonPrefix += rkCommonPrefix;
1101    if (rkCommonPrefix != rLen1) {
1102      // Early out when RK is not fully matching.
1103      return commonPrefix;
1104    }
1105    // Compare 1 byte CF length part
1106    byte fLen1 = c1.getFamilyLength();
1107    if (bypassFamilyCheck) {
1108      // This flag will be true when caller is sure that the family will be same for both the cells
1109      // Just make commonPrefix to increment by the family part
1110      commonPrefix += KeyValue.FAMILY_LENGTH_SIZE + fLen1;
1111    } else {
1112      byte fLen2 = c2.getFamilyLength();
1113      if (fLen1 != fLen2) {
1114        // early out when the CF length itself is not matching
1115        return commonPrefix;
1116      }
1117      // CF lengths are same so there is one more byte common in key part
1118      commonPrefix += KeyValue.FAMILY_LENGTH_SIZE;
1119      // Compare the CF names
1120      int fCommonPrefix;
1121      if (c1 instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell && c2 instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
1122        fCommonPrefix =
1123          ByteBufferUtils.findCommonPrefix(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c1).getFamilyByteBuffer(),
1124            ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c1).getFamilyPosition(), fLen1,
1125            ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c2).getFamilyByteBuffer(),
1126            ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c2).getFamilyPosition(), fLen2);
1127      } else {
1128        fCommonPrefix = ByteBufferUtils.findCommonPrefix(c1.getFamilyArray(), c1.getFamilyOffset(),
1129          fLen1, c2.getFamilyArray(), c2.getFamilyOffset(), fLen2);
1130      }
1131      commonPrefix += fCommonPrefix;
1132      if (fCommonPrefix != fLen1) {
1133        return commonPrefix;
1134      }
1135    }
1136    // Compare the Qualifiers
1137    int qLen1 = c1.getQualifierLength();
1138    int qLen2 = c2.getQualifierLength();
1139    int qCommon;
1140    if (c1 instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell && c2 instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
1141      qCommon =
1142        ByteBufferUtils.findCommonPrefix(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c1).getQualifierByteBuffer(),
1143          ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c1).getQualifierPosition(), qLen1,
1144          ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c2).getQualifierByteBuffer(),
1145          ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) c2).getQualifierPosition(), qLen2);
1146    } else {
1147      qCommon = ByteBufferUtils.findCommonPrefix(c1.getQualifierArray(), c1.getQualifierOffset(),
1148        qLen1, c2.getQualifierArray(), c2.getQualifierOffset(), qLen2);
1149    }
1150    commonPrefix += qCommon;
1151    if (!withTsType || Math.max(qLen1, qLen2) != qCommon) {
1152      return commonPrefix;
1153    }
1154    // Compare the timestamp parts
1155    int tsCommonPrefix = ByteBufferUtils.findCommonPrefix(Bytes.toBytes(c1.getTimestamp()), 0,
1156      KeyValue.TIMESTAMP_SIZE, Bytes.toBytes(c2.getTimestamp()), 0, KeyValue.TIMESTAMP_SIZE);
1157    commonPrefix += tsCommonPrefix;
1158    if (tsCommonPrefix != KeyValue.TIMESTAMP_SIZE) {
1159      return commonPrefix;
1160    }
1161    // Compare the type
1162    if (c1.getTypeByte() == c2.getTypeByte()) {
1163      commonPrefix += KeyValue.TYPE_SIZE;
1164    }
1165    return commonPrefix;
1166  }
1167
1168  /**
1169   * Used to compare two cells based on the column hint provided. This is specifically used when we
1170   * need to optimize the seeks based on the next indexed key. This is an advanced usage API
1171   * specifically needed for some optimizations.
1172   * @param nextIndexedCell the next indexed cell
1173   * @param currentCell     the cell to be compared
1174   * @param foff            the family offset of the currentCell
1175   * @param flen            the family length of the currentCell
1176   * @param colHint         the column hint provided - could be null
1177   * @param coff            the offset of the column hint if provided, if not offset of the
1178   *                        currentCell's qualifier
1179   * @param clen            the length of the column hint if provided, if not length of the
1180   *                        currentCell's qualifier
1181   * @param ts              the timestamp to be seeked
1182   * @param type            the type to be seeked
1183   * @return an int based on the given column hint TODO : To be moved out of here because this is a
1184   *         special API used in scan optimization.
1185   */
1186  // compare a key against row/fam/qual/ts/type
1187  public static final int compareKeyBasedOnColHint(CellComparator comparator,
1188    ExtendedCell nextIndexedCell, ExtendedCell currentCell, int foff, int flen, byte[] colHint,
1189    int coff, int clen, long ts, byte type) {
1190    int compare = comparator.compareRows(nextIndexedCell, currentCell);
1191    if (compare != 0) {
1192      return compare;
1193    }
1194    // If the column is not specified, the "minimum" key type appears the
1195    // latest in the sorted order, regardless of the timestamp. This is used
1196    // for specifying the last key/value in a given row, because there is no
1197    // "lexicographically last column" (it would be infinitely long). The
1198    // "maximum" key type does not need this behavior.
1199    if (
1200      nextIndexedCell.getFamilyLength() + nextIndexedCell.getQualifierLength() == 0
1201        && nextIndexedCell.getTypeByte() == KeyValue.Type.Minimum.getCode()
1202    ) {
1203      // left is "bigger", i.e. it appears later in the sorted order
1204      return 1;
1205    }
1206    if (flen + clen == 0 && type == KeyValue.Type.Minimum.getCode()) {
1207      return -1;
1208    }
1209
1210    compare = comparator.compareFamilies(nextIndexedCell, currentCell);
1211    if (compare != 0) {
1212      return compare;
1213    }
1214    if (colHint == null) {
1215      compare = comparator.compareQualifiers(nextIndexedCell, currentCell);
1216    } else {
1217      compare = CellUtil.compareQualifiers(nextIndexedCell, colHint, coff, clen);
1218    }
1219    if (compare != 0) {
1220      return compare;
1221    }
1222    // Next compare timestamps.
1223    compare = comparator.compareTimestamps(nextIndexedCell.getTimestamp(), ts);
1224    if (compare != 0) {
1225      return compare;
1226    }
1227
1228    // Compare types. Let the delete types sort ahead of puts; i.e. types
1229    // of higher numbers sort before those of lesser numbers. Maximum (255)
1230    // appears ahead of everything, and minimum (0) appears after
1231    // everything.
1232    return (0xff & type) - (0xff & nextIndexedCell.getTypeByte());
1233  }
1234
1235  /**
1236   * Compares only the key portion of a cell. It does not include the sequence id/mvcc of the cell
1237   * @return an int greater than 0 if left &gt; than right lesser than 0 if left &lt; than right
1238   *         equal to 0 if left is equal to right
1239   */
1240  public static final int compareKeyIgnoresMvcc(CellComparator comparator, Cell left, Cell right) {
1241    return ((CellComparatorImpl) comparator).compare(left, right, true);
1242  }
1243
1244  /**
1245   * Compare cell's row against given comparator
1246   * @param cell       the cell to use for comparison
1247   * @param comparator the {@link CellComparator} to use for comparison
1248   * @return result comparing cell's row
1249   */
1250  public static int compareRow(Cell cell, ByteArrayComparable comparator) {
1251    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
1252      return comparator.compareTo(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowByteBuffer(),
1253        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowPosition(), cell.getRowLength());
1254    }
1255    return comparator.compareTo(cell.getRowArray(), cell.getRowOffset(), cell.getRowLength());
1256  }
1257
1258  /**
1259   * Compare cell's column family against given comparator
1260   * @param cell       the cell to use for comparison
1261   * @param comparator the {@link CellComparator} to use for comparison
1262   * @return result comparing cell's column family
1263   */
1264  public static int compareFamily(Cell cell, ByteArrayComparable comparator) {
1265    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
1266      return comparator.compareTo(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getFamilyByteBuffer(),
1267        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getFamilyPosition(), cell.getFamilyLength());
1268    }
1269    return comparator.compareTo(cell.getFamilyArray(), cell.getFamilyOffset(),
1270      cell.getFamilyLength());
1271  }
1272
1273  /**
1274   * Compare cell's qualifier against given comparator
1275   * @param cell       the cell to use for comparison
1276   * @param comparator the {@link CellComparator} to use for comparison
1277   * @return result comparing cell's qualifier
1278   */
1279  public static int compareQualifier(Cell cell, ByteArrayComparable comparator) {
1280    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
1281      return comparator.compareTo(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getQualifierByteBuffer(),
1282        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getQualifierPosition(), cell.getQualifierLength());
1283    }
1284    return comparator.compareTo(cell.getQualifierArray(), cell.getQualifierOffset(),
1285      cell.getQualifierLength());
1286  }
1287
1288  public static Cell.Type toType(byte type) {
1289    KeyValue.Type codeToType = KeyValue.Type.codeToType(type);
1290    switch (codeToType) {
1291      case Put:
1292        return Cell.Type.Put;
1293      case Delete:
1294        return Cell.Type.Delete;
1295      case DeleteColumn:
1296        return Cell.Type.DeleteColumn;
1297      case DeleteFamily:
1298        return Cell.Type.DeleteFamily;
1299      case DeleteFamilyVersion:
1300        return Cell.Type.DeleteFamilyVersion;
1301      default:
1302        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Invalid type of cell " + type);
1303    }
1304  }
1305
1306  public static KeyValue.Type toTypeByte(Cell.Type type) {
1307    switch (type) {
1308      case Put:
1309        return KeyValue.Type.Put;
1310      case Delete:
1311        return KeyValue.Type.Delete;
1312      case DeleteColumn:
1313        return KeyValue.Type.DeleteColumn;
1314      case DeleteFamilyVersion:
1315        return KeyValue.Type.DeleteFamilyVersion;
1316      case DeleteFamily:
1317        return KeyValue.Type.DeleteFamily;
1318      default:
1319        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Unsupported data type:" + type);
1320    }
1321  }
1322
1323  /**
1324   * Compare cell's value against given comparator
1325   * @param cell       the cell to use for comparison
1326   * @param comparator the {@link CellComparator} to use for comparison
1327   * @return result comparing cell's value
1328   */
1329  public static int compareValue(Cell cell, ByteArrayComparable comparator) {
1330    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
1331      return comparator.compareTo(((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getValueByteBuffer(),
1332        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getValuePosition(), cell.getValueLength());
1333    }
1334    return comparator.compareTo(cell.getValueArray(), cell.getValueOffset(), cell.getValueLength());
1335  }
1336
1337  /**
1338   * These cells are used in reseeks/seeks to improve the read performance. They are not real cells
1339   * that are returned back to the clients
1340   */
1341  private static abstract class EmptyCell implements ExtendedCell {
1342
1343    @Override
1344    public void setSequenceId(long seqId) {
1345      // Fake cells don't need seqId, so leaving it as a noop.
1346    }
1347
1348    @Override

1350      // Fake cells can't be changed timestamp, so leaving it as a noop.
1351    }
1352
1353    @Override

1355      // Fake cells can't be changed timestamp, so leaving it as a noop.
1356    }
1357
1358    @Override

1360      return EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY;
1361    }
1362
1363    @Override

1365      return 0;
1366    }

1370      return 0;
1371    }

1439  /**
1440   * These cells are used in reseeks/seeks to improve the read performance. They are not real cells
1441   * that are returned back to the clients
1442   */
1443  private static abstract class EmptyByteBufferExtendedCell extends ByteBufferExtendedCell {
1444
1445    @Override
1446    public void setSequenceId(long seqId) {
1447      // Fake cells don't need seqId, so leaving it as a noop.
1448    }
1449
1450    @Override
1451    public void setTimestamp(long ts) {
1452      // Fake cells can't be changed timestamp, so leaving it as a noop.
1453    }
1454
1455    @Override
1456    public void setTimestamp(byte[] ts) {
1457      // Fake cells can't be changed timestamp, so leaving it as a noop.
1458    }
1459
1460    @Override
1461    public byte[] getRowArray() {
1462      return CellUtil.cloneRow(this);
1463    }
1464
1465    @Override
1466    public int getRowOffset() {
1467      return 0;
1468    }
1469
1470    @Override
1471    public short getRowLength() {
1472      return 0;
1473    }
1474
1475    @Override
1476    public byte[] getFamilyArray() {
1477      return CellUtil.cloneFamily(this);
1478    }
1479
1480    @Override
1481    public int getFamilyOffset() {
1482      return 0;
1483    }
1484
1485    @Override
1486    public byte getFamilyLength() {
1487      return 0;
1488    }
1489
1490    @Override
1491    public byte[] getQualifierArray() {
1492      return CellUtil.cloneQualifier(this);
1493    }
1494
1495    @Override
1496    public int getQualifierOffset() {
1497      return 0;
1498    }
1499
1500    @Override
1501    public int getQualifierLength() {
1502      return 0;
1503    }
1504
1505    @Override
1506    public long getSequenceId() {
1507      return 0;
1508    }
1509
1510    @Override
1511    public byte[] getValueArray() {
1512      return CellUtil.cloneValue(this);
1513    }
1514
1515    @Override
1516    public int getValueOffset() {
1517      return 0;
1518    }
1519
1520    @Override
1521    public int getValueLength() {
1522      return 0;
1523    }
1524
1525    @Override
1526    public byte[] getTagsArray() {
1527      return PrivateCellUtil.cloneTags(this);
1528    }
1529
1530    @Override
1531    public int getTagsOffset() {
1532      return 0;
1533    }
1534
1535    @Override
1536    public int getTagsLength() {
1537      return 0;
1538    }
1539
1540    @Override
1541    public ByteBuffer getRowByteBuffer() {
1542      return HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_BUFFER;
1543    }
1544
1545    @Override

1547      return 0;
1548    }
1549

1552      return HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_BUFFER;
1553    }
1554
1555    @Override

1557      return 0;
1558    }
1559
1560    @Override
1561    public ByteBuffer getQualifierByteBuffer() {
1562      return HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_BUFFER;
1563    }
1564

1590
1591  private static class FirstOnRowCell extends EmptyCell {
1592    // @formatter:off
1593    private static final int FIXED_HEAPSIZE =
1594        ClassSize.OBJECT // object
1595      + ClassSize.REFERENCE // row array
1596      + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT // row offset
1597      + Bytes.SIZEOF_SHORT;  // row length
1598    // @formatter:on
1599    private final byte[] rowArray;
1600    private final int roffset;
1601    private final short rlength;
1602
1603    public FirstOnRowCell(final byte[] row, int roffset, short rlength) {
1604      this.rowArray = row;
1605      this.roffset = roffset;
1606      this.rlength = rlength;
1607    }
1608
1609    @Override
1610    public long heapSize() {
1611      return ClassSize.align(FIXED_HEAPSIZE)
1612        // array overhead
1613        + (rlength == 0 ? ClassSize.sizeOfByteArray(rlength) : rlength);
1614    }
1615
1616    @Override
1617    public byte[] getRowArray() {
1618      return this.rowArray;
1619    }
1620
1621    @Override
1622    public int getRowOffset() {
1623      return this.roffset;
1624    }
1625
1626    @Override
1627    public short getRowLength() {
1628      return this.rlength;
1629    }
1630
1631    @Override
1632    public long getTimestamp() {
1633      return HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP;
1634    }
1635
1636    @Override
1637    public byte getTypeByte() {
1638      return KeyValue.Type.Maximum.getCode();
1639    }
1640
1641    @Override
1642    public Type getType() {
1643      throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1644    }
1645  }
1646
1647  private static class FirstOnRowByteBufferExtendedCell extends EmptyByteBufferExtendedCell {
1648    // @formatter:off
1649    private static final int FIXED_OVERHEAD =
1650        ClassSize.OBJECT // object
1651        + ClassSize.REFERENCE // row buffer
1652        + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT // row offset
1653        + Bytes.SIZEOF_SHORT; // row length
1654    // @formatter:on
1655    private final ByteBuffer rowBuff;
1656    private final int roffset;
1657    private final short rlength;
1658
1659    public FirstOnRowByteBufferExtendedCell(final ByteBuffer row, int roffset, short rlength) {
1660      this.rowBuff = row;
1661      this.roffset = roffset;
1662      this.rlength = rlength;
1663    }
1664
1665    @Override
1666    public long heapSize() {
1667      if (this.rowBuff.hasArray()) {
1668        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + rlength);
1669      }
1670      return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD);
1671    }
1672
1673    @Override
1674    public ByteBuffer getRowByteBuffer() {
1675      return this.rowBuff;
1676    }
1677
1678    @Override
1679    public int getRowPosition() {
1680      return this.roffset;
1681    }
1682
1683    @Override
1684    public short getRowLength() {
1685      return this.rlength;
1686    }
1687
1688    @Override
1689    public long getTimestamp() {
1690      return HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP;
1691    }
1692
1693    @Override
1694    public byte getTypeByte() {
1695      return KeyValue.Type.Maximum.getCode();
1696    }
1697
1698    @Override
1699    public Type getType() {
1700      throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1701    }
1702  }

1704  private static class LastOnRowByteBufferExtendedCell extends EmptyByteBufferExtendedCell {
1705    // @formatter:off

1707      + ClassSize.REFERENCE // rowBuff
1708      + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT // roffset
1709      + Bytes.SIZEOF_SHORT; // rlength
1710    // @formatter:on
1711    private final ByteBuffer rowBuff;
1712    private final int roffset;
1713    private final short rlength;

1715    public LastOnRowByteBufferExtendedCell(final ByteBuffer row, int roffset, short rlength) {
1716      this.rowBuff = row;
1717      this.roffset = roffset;
1718      this.rlength = rlength;
1719    }
1720
1721    @Override
1722    public long heapSize() {
1723      if (this.rowBuff.hasArray()) {
1724        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + rlength);
1725      }
1726      return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD);
1727    }
1728
1729    @Override
1730    public ByteBuffer getRowByteBuffer() {
1731      return this.rowBuff;
1732    }
1733

1737    }

1739    @Override
1740    public short getRowLength() {
1741      return this.rlength;
1742    }

1746      return PrivateConstants.OLDEST_TIMESTAMP;
1747    }

1752    }

1759
1760  private static class FirstOnRowColByteBufferExtendedCell
1761    extends FirstOnRowByteBufferExtendedCell {
1762    // @formatter:off
1763    private static final int FIXED_OVERHEAD = FirstOnRowByteBufferExtendedCell.FIXED_OVERHEAD
1764      + ClassSize.REFERENCE * 2 // family buffer and column buffer
1765      + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT * 3 // famOffset, colOffset, colLength
1766      + Bytes.SIZEOF_BYTE; // famLength
1767    // @formatter:on
1768    private final ByteBuffer famBuff;
1769    private final int famOffset;
1770    private final byte famLength;
1771    private final ByteBuffer colBuff;
1772    private final int colOffset;
1773    private final int colLength;
1774
1775    public FirstOnRowColByteBufferExtendedCell(final ByteBuffer row, int roffset, short rlength,
1776      final ByteBuffer famBuff, final int famOffset, final byte famLength, final ByteBuffer col,
1777      final int colOffset, final int colLength) {
1778      super(row, roffset, rlength);
1779      this.famBuff = famBuff;
1780      this.famOffset = famOffset;
1781      this.famLength = famLength;
1782      this.colBuff = col;
1783      this.colOffset = colOffset;
1784      this.colLength = colLength;
1785    }
1786
1787    @Override
1788    public long heapSize() {
1789      if (famBuff.hasArray() && colBuff.hasArray()) {
1790        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + famLength + colLength);
1791      } else if (famBuff.hasArray()) {
1792        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + famLength);
1793      } else if (colBuff.hasArray()) {
1794        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + colLength);
1795      } else {
1796        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD);
1797      }
1798    }
1799
1800    @Override
1801    public ByteBuffer getFamilyByteBuffer() {
1802      return this.famBuff;
1803    }
1804
1805    @Override
1806    public int getFamilyPosition() {
1807      return this.famOffset;
1808    }
1809
1810    @Override
1811    public byte getFamilyLength() {
1812      return famLength;
1813    }
1814
1815    @Override
1816    public ByteBuffer getQualifierByteBuffer() {
1817      return this.colBuff;
1818    }
1819
1820    @Override
1821    public int getQualifierPosition() {
1822      return this.colOffset;
1823    }
1824
1825    @Override
1826    public int getQualifierLength() {
1827      return this.colLength;
1828    }
1829  }
1830
1831  private static class FirstOnRowColCell extends FirstOnRowCell {
1832    // @formatter:off
1833    private static final long FIXED_HEAPSIZE = (long) FirstOnRowCell.FIXED_HEAPSIZE
1834      + Bytes.SIZEOF_BYTE // flength
1835      + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT * 3 // foffset, qoffset, qlength
1836      + ClassSize.REFERENCE * 2; // fArray, qArray
1837    // @formatter:on
1838    private final byte[] fArray;
1839    private final int foffset;
1840    private final byte flength;
1841    private final byte[] qArray;
1842    private final int qoffset;
1843    private final int qlength;
1844
1845    public FirstOnRowColCell(byte[] rArray, int roffset, short rlength, byte[] fArray, int foffset,
1846      byte flength, byte[] qArray, int qoffset, int qlength) {
1847      super(rArray, roffset, rlength);
1848      this.fArray = fArray;
1849      this.foffset = foffset;
1850      this.flength = flength;
1851      this.qArray = qArray;
1852      this.qoffset = qoffset;
1853      this.qlength = qlength;
1854    }
1855
1856    @Override
1857    public long heapSize() {
1858      return ClassSize.align(FIXED_HEAPSIZE)
1859        // array overhead
1860        + (flength == 0 ? ClassSize.sizeOfByteArray(flength) : flength)
1861        + (qlength == 0 ? ClassSize.sizeOfByteArray(qlength) : qlength);
1862    }
1863
1864    @Override
1865    public byte[] getFamilyArray() {
1866      return this.fArray;
1867    }
1868
1869    @Override
1870    public int getFamilyOffset() {
1871      return this.foffset;
1872    }
1873
1874    @Override
1875    public byte getFamilyLength() {
1876      return this.flength;
1877    }
1878
1879    @Override
1880    public byte[] getQualifierArray() {
1881      return this.qArray;
1882    }
1883
1884    @Override
1885    public int getQualifierOffset() {
1886      return this.qoffset;
1887    }
1888
1889    @Override
1890    public int getQualifierLength() {
1891      return this.qlength;
1892    }
1893  }

1895  private static class FirstOnRowColTSCell extends FirstOnRowColCell {

1897    private static final long FIXED_HEAPSIZE = FirstOnRowColCell.FIXED_HEAPSIZE
1898      + Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG; // ts
1899    private long ts;
1900    // @formatter:on
1901
1902    public FirstOnRowColTSCell(byte[] rArray, int roffset, short rlength, byte[] fArray,
1903      int foffset, byte flength, byte[] qArray, int qoffset, int qlength, long ts) {
1904      super(rArray, roffset, rlength, fArray, foffset, flength, qArray, qoffset, qlength);
1905      this.ts = ts;
1906    }
1907
1908    @Override
1909    public long getTimestamp() {
1910      return this.ts;
1911    }
1912
1913    @Override
1914    public long heapSize() {
1915      return ClassSize.align(FIXED_HEAPSIZE);
1916    }
1917  }

1919  private static class FirstOnRowColTSByteBufferExtendedCell
1920    extends FirstOnRowColByteBufferExtendedCell {
1921    // @formatter:off
1922    private static final int FIXED_OVERHEAD = FirstOnRowColByteBufferExtendedCell.FIXED_OVERHEAD
1923      + Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG; // ts
1924    private long ts;
1925    // @formatter:on
1926
1927    public FirstOnRowColTSByteBufferExtendedCell(ByteBuffer rBuffer, int roffset, short rlength,
1928      ByteBuffer fBuffer, int foffset, byte flength, ByteBuffer qBuffer, int qoffset, int qlength,
1929      long ts) {

1931      this.ts = ts;
1932    }
1933
1934    @Override
1935    public long getTimestamp() {
1936      return this.ts;
1937    }
1938
1939    @Override
1940    public long heapSize() {
1941      return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + super.heapSize());
1942    }

2064  private static class LastOnRowColByteBufferExtendedCell extends LastOnRowByteBufferExtendedCell {
2065    // @formatter:off
2066    private static final int FIXED_OVERHEAD = LastOnRowByteBufferExtendedCell.FIXED_OVERHEAD
2067      + ClassSize.REFERENCE * 2 // fBuffer and qBuffer
2068      + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT * 3 // foffset, qoffset, qlength
2069      + Bytes.SIZEOF_BYTE; // flength
2070    // @formatter:on

2072    private final int foffset;
2073    private final byte flength;
2074    private final ByteBuffer qBuffer;

2076    private final int qlength;

2085      this.qoffset = qoffset;
2086      this.qlength = qlength;
2087    }

2092        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + flength + qlength);
2093      } else if (fBuffer.hasArray()) {
2094        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + flength);
2095      } else if (qBuffer.hasArray()) {
2096        return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD + qlength);

2133  private static class FirstOnRowDeleteFamilyCell extends EmptyCell {
2134    // @formatter:off
2135    private static final int FIXED_OVERHEAD = ClassSize.OBJECT // object
2136      + ClassSize.REFERENCE * 2 // fBuffer and qBuffer
2137      + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT * 3 // foffset, qoffset, qlength
2138      + Bytes.SIZEOF_BYTE; // flength
2139    // @formatter:on
2140    private final byte[] row;
2141    private final byte[] fam;
2142
2143    public FirstOnRowDeleteFamilyCell(byte[] row, byte[] fam) {
2144      this.row = row;
2145      this.fam = fam;
2146    }
2147
2148    @Override
2149    public long heapSize() {
2150      return ClassSize.align(FIXED_OVERHEAD)
2151        // array overhead
2152        + (getRowLength() == 0 ? ClassSize.sizeOfByteArray(getRowLength()) : getRowLength())
2153        + (getFamilyLength() == 0
2154          ? ClassSize.sizeOfByteArray(getFamilyLength())
2155          : getFamilyLength());
2156    }
2157
2158    @Override
2159    public byte[] getRowArray() {
2160      return this.row;
2161    }
2162
2163    @Override
2164    public short getRowLength() {
2165      return (short) this.row.length;
2166    }
2167
2168    @Override
2169    public byte[] getFamilyArray() {
2170      return this.fam;
2171    }
2172
2173    @Override
2174    public byte getFamilyLength() {
2175      return (byte) this.fam.length;
2176    }
2177
2178    @Override
2179    public long getTimestamp() {
2180      return HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP;
2181    }
2182
2183    @Override
2184    public byte getTypeByte() {
2185      return KeyValue.Type.DeleteFamily.getCode();
2186    }
2187
2188    @Override
2189    public Type getType() {
2190      return Type.DeleteFamily;
2191    }
2192  }
2193
2194  /**
2195   * Writes the Cell's key part as it would have serialized in a KeyValue. The format is &lt;2 bytes
2196   * rk len&gt;&lt;rk&gt;&lt;1 byte cf len&gt;&lt;cf&gt;&lt;qualifier&gt;&lt;8 bytes
2197   * timestamp&gt;&lt;1 byte type&gt;
2198   */
2199  public static void writeFlatKey(Cell cell, DataOutput out) throws IOException {
2200    short rowLen = cell.getRowLength();
2201    byte fLen = cell.getFamilyLength();
2202    int qLen = cell.getQualifierLength();
2203    // Using just one if/else loop instead of every time checking before writing every
2204    // component of cell
2205    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
2206      out.writeShort(rowLen);
2207      ByteBufferUtils.copyBufferToStream(out, ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowByteBuffer(),
2208        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowPosition(), rowLen);
2209      out.writeByte(fLen);
2210      ByteBufferUtils.copyBufferToStream(out, ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getFamilyByteBuffer(),
2211        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getFamilyPosition(), fLen);
2212      ByteBufferUtils.copyBufferToStream(out,
2213        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getQualifierByteBuffer(),
2214        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getQualifierPosition(), qLen);
2215    } else {
2216      out.writeShort(rowLen);
2217      out.write(cell.getRowArray(), cell.getRowOffset(), rowLen);
2218      out.writeByte(fLen);
2219      out.write(cell.getFamilyArray(), cell.getFamilyOffset(), fLen);
2220      out.write(cell.getQualifierArray(), cell.getQualifierOffset(), qLen);
2221    }
2222    out.writeLong(cell.getTimestamp());
2223    out.writeByte(cell.getTypeByte());
2224  }
2225
2226  /**
2227   * Deep clones the given cell if the cell supports deep cloning
2228   * @param cell the cell to be cloned
2229   * @return the cloned cell
2230   */
2231  public static Cell deepClone(Cell cell) throws CloneNotSupportedException {
2232    if (cell instanceof ExtendedCell) {
2233      return ((ExtendedCell) cell).deepClone();
2234    }
2235    throw new CloneNotSupportedException();
2236  }
2237
2238  /**
2239   * Writes the cell to the given OutputStream
2240   * @param cell     the cell to be written
2241   * @param out      the outputstream
2242   * @param withTags if tags are to be written or not
2243   * @return the total bytes written
2244   */
2245  public static int writeCell(Cell cell, OutputStream out, boolean withTags) throws IOException {
2246    if (cell instanceof ExtendedCell) {
2247      return ((ExtendedCell) cell).write(out, withTags);
2248    } else {
2249      ByteBufferUtils.putInt(out, estimatedSerializedSizeOfKey(cell));
2250      ByteBufferUtils.putInt(out, cell.getValueLength());
2251      writeFlatKey(cell, out);
2252      writeValue(out, cell, cell.getValueLength());
2253      int tagsLength = cell.getTagsLength();
2254      if (withTags) {
2255        byte[] len = new byte[Bytes.SIZEOF_SHORT];
2256        Bytes.putAsShort(len, 0, tagsLength);
2257        out.write(len);
2258        if (tagsLength > 0) {
2259          writeTags(out, cell, tagsLength);
2260        }
2261      }
2262      int lenWritten =
2263        (2 * Bytes.SIZEOF_INT) + estimatedSerializedSizeOfKey(cell) + cell.getValueLength();
2264      if (withTags) {
2265        lenWritten += Bytes.SIZEOF_SHORT + tagsLength;
2266      }
2267      return lenWritten;
2268    }
2269  }
2270
2271  /**
2272   * Writes a cell to the buffer at the given offset
2273   * @param cell   the cell to be written
2274   * @param buf    the buffer to which the cell has to be wrriten
2275   * @param offset the offset at which the cell should be written
2276   */
2277  public static void writeCellToBuffer(Cell cell, ByteBuffer buf, int offset) {
2278    if (cell instanceof ExtendedCell) {
2279      ((ExtendedCell) cell).write(buf, offset);
2280    } else {
2281      // Using the KVUtil
2282      byte[] bytes = KeyValueUtil.copyToNewByteArray(cell);
2283      ByteBufferUtils.copyFromArrayToBuffer(buf, offset, bytes, 0, bytes.length);
2284    }
2285  }
2286
2287  public static int writeFlatKey(Cell cell, OutputStream out) throws IOException {
2288    short rowLen = cell.getRowLength();
2289    byte fLen = cell.getFamilyLength();
2290    int qLen = cell.getQualifierLength();
2291    // Using just one if/else loop instead of every time checking before writing every
2292    // component of cell
2293    if (cell instanceof ByteBufferExtendedCell) {
2294      StreamUtils.writeShort(out, rowLen);
2295      ByteBufferUtils.copyBufferToStream(out, ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowByteBuffer(),
2296        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getRowPosition(), rowLen);
2297      out.write(fLen);
2298      ByteBufferUtils.copyBufferToStream(out, ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getFamilyByteBuffer(),
2299        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getFamilyPosition(), fLen);
2300      ByteBufferUtils.copyBufferToStream(out,
2301        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getQualifierByteBuffer(),
2302        ((ByteBufferExtendedCell) cell).getQualifierPosition(), qLen);
2303    } else {
2304      StreamUtils.writeShort(out, rowLen);
2305      out.write(cell.getRowArray(), cell.getRowOffset(), rowLen);
2306      out.write(fLen);
2307      out.write(cell.getFamilyArray(), cell.getFamilyOffset(), fLen);
2308      out.write(cell.getQualifierArray(), cell.getQualifierOffset(), qLen);
2309    }
2310    StreamUtils.writeLong(out, cell.getTimestamp());
2311    out.write(cell.getTypeByte());
2312    return Bytes.SIZEOF_SHORT + rowLen + Bytes.SIZEOF_BYTE + fLen + qLen + Bytes.SIZEOF_LONG
2313      + Bytes.SIZEOF_BYTE;
2314  }

2361   */

2478
2479  /**
2480   * special case for Cell.equals
2481   */
2482  public static boolean equalsIgnoreMvccVersion(Cell a, Cell b) {
2483    // row
2484    boolean res = CellUtil.matchingRows(a, b);
2485    if (!res) return res;
2486
2487    // family
2488    res = CellUtil.matchingColumn(a, b);
2489    if (!res) return res;
2490
2491    // timestamp: later sorts first
2492    if (!CellUtil.matchingTimestamp(a, b)) return false;
2493
2494    // type
2495    int c = (0xff & b.getTypeByte()) - (0xff & a.getTypeByte());
2496    if (c != 0) return false;
2497    else return true;
2498  }
